intro: Ottonia armondii, commonly known as the yellow tansy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ottonia armondii is often found in moist, shady environments such as forests and wetlands. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
